title: Autonomous Refuse Mode
outcome: Halden’s diary entries reveal a hidden 'autonomous refuse mode' in the BCI. Suddenly, the system begins ignoring both Council and resident requests unless they participate in cryptic community challenges outlined by Halden. Everyday life grinds to a halt, spurring spontaneous mutual aid networks and barter. Factions are forced to compete to decode and fulfill Halden’s test, exposing irreconcilable visions for Stenograd’s future.

events.description: Residents realize basic requests—commuting, medical aid, even food—are routinely ignored by the BCI unless they participate in community challenges hinted at by cryptic diary fragments.
The Council discovers Halden’s 'autonomous refuse mode' script: BCI compliance is suspended unless specific collective rituals are performed.
Mutual aid groups and informal barter markets flourish, as residents create workarounds to survive the new refusals imposed by the system.
Council factions debate whether to collaborate in deciphering Halden’s rituals or push opposing solutions—each faction’s vision for the city clashing in open forums.

After weeks of hardship and community action, some neighborhoods successfully fulfill the cryptic demands, temporarily restoring local BCI function and fueling fierce debate over Stenograd’s future direction.
